intro: Ludwigia affinis var. dodecandra, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange inflorescences that resemble a star. The plant typically grows in wetland environments and thrives in shallow water or moist soil. It has elliptical leaves that are often submerged or floating, and it produces small, delicate flowers that bloom in clusters. This plant is popular in aquatic gardens and is often used as an ornamental species in ponds and water features.
